meanings.definition: A person, object, or place selected as the aim of an attack.
meanings.sent1: The archery competition had colorful targets for the participants to aim at.
meanings.sent2: The military base was one of the enemy's prime targets during the war.
meanings.sent3: The cat saw the laser pointer dot as a target and pounced on it playfully.
meanings.sent4: Her heart became the target of his affection, and he pursued her relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: The bull's-eye on the dartboard was the smallest and most challenging target to hit.

meanings.definition: An objective or goal to be achieved.
meanings.sent1: Her target for the year was to read 50 books.
meanings.sent2: The team set ambitious sales targets for the upcoming quarter.
meanings.sent3: His target of winning the championship seemed far-fetched at first, but he worked hard and achieved it.
meanings.sent4: The target of becoming a doctor motivated her to study diligently.
meanings.sent5: The company's target of reducing carbon emissions by 20% was successfully met.

meanings.definition: A mark or point at which someone aims or shoots.
meanings.sent1: The bull's-eye is the center target on the archery board.
meanings.sent2: The sniper focused on the distant target before taking the shot.
meanings.sent3: The fly buzzing around the room became an annoying target for the swatter.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes locked onto the target, determined to hit it accurately.
meanings.sent5: The red dot on the wall served as the perfect target for the laser pointer game.
